alert.note: Alert for Somerset; Wicomico; Worcester (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 03 at 6:22PM EDT until July 03 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Somerset County in southeastern Maryland... Southeastern Wicomico County in southeastern Maryland... Southwestern Worcester County in southeastern Maryland... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 621 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Lawsonia, or 13 miles southwest of Princess Anne, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Marion Station around 625 PM EDT. Westover around 635 PM EDT. Princess Anne around 640 PM EDT. University Of Maryland Eastern Shore and West Pocomoke around 645 PM EDT. Fruitland and Salisbury University around 655 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Trinity, Cokesbury, Goodwill, Eden, Kingston, Shelltown, Longridge, Cedartown, Chesapeake Heights and Mount Wesley. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
